text: Kim Jung-Woo (born 9 May 1982) is a South Korean professional athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team.National-Football-Teams.com, "Kim Jung-Woo"; retrieved 2012-9.5 == Career statistics == === Club === Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League League League National cup National cup League cup League cup Continental Continental Total Total Club Season Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i 2003 K League 34 1 4 0 — — 38 1 Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i 2004 K League 18 0 4 0 0 0 — 22 0 Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i 2005 K League 23 0 1 0 9 0 — 33 0 Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i Total 75 1 9 0 9 0 — 93 1 Nagoya Grampus Eight 2006 J1 League 25 3 1 0 4 0 — 30 3 Nagoya Grampus Eight 2007 J1 League 27 4 1 0 2 0 — 30 4 Nagoya Grampus Eight Total 52 7 2 0 6 0 — 60 7 Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma 2008 K League 22 4 2 0 8 1 — 32 5 Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma 2009 K League 28 3 5 1 7 2 — 40 6 Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma 2011 K League 2 0 0 0 — — 2 0 Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma Total 52 7 7 1 15 3 — 74 11 Sangju Sangmu Phoenix (draft) 2010 K League 19 3 2 0 0 0 — 21 3 Sangju Sangmu Phoenix (draft) 2011 K League 21 15 2 1 5 3 — 28 19 Sangju Sangmu Phoenix (draft) Total 40 18 4 1 5 3 — 49 22 Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors 2012 K League 33 5 2 0 — 5 0 40 5 Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors 2013 K League 1 8 0 0 0 — 6 1 14 1 Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors Total 41 5 2 0 — 11 1 54 6 Al Sharjah (loan) 2013–14 UAE Pro League 21 1 0 0 6 0 — 27 1 Baniyas 2014–15 UAE Pro League 6 0 0 0 5 0 — 11 0 BEC Tero Sasana 2016 Thai League 1 3 0 ? ? ? ? — 3 0 Career total Career total Career total 290 39 24 2 46 6 11 1 371 48 === International === Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals South Korea 2003 2 0 South Korea 2004 6 0 South Korea 2005 11 0 South Korea 2006 6 0 South Korea 2007 10 1 South Korea 2008 5 0 South Korea 2009 9 1 South Korea 2010 14 2 South Korea 2011 6 2 South Korea 2012 2 0 Career total 71 6 Results list South Korea's goal tally first.
